title: Drawing, 1938-88-1741, mid-1530s
medium: Pen and brown ink, black chalk ruled with straight edge on off white laid paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward Brandegee, Brookline, Mass.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Decoration of statuary base for Genoese naval hero and imperial admiral Adrea Doria, whose successes are commemorated in the marine scene seen in the framed relief on the pedestal. Surrounding this scene are two cloaked herms, supporting capitals and the upper portion of the base. Turtles and sphinxes with fishtails and a satyr mask complete the decoration.

exhibitions.title: Disegno: Italian Renaissance Designs for the Decorative Arts
